title: Cookies won't delete
content: I have tried many times and many ways to delete cookies but the little blighters won't delete. I have used the option "manage data" and cleared each one individually, I have tried "remove all' and I have tried clearing all history. I have tried each option many times and have shut down firefox and my mac repeatedly but the cookies won't go. I know it has done something because it logged me out of all my accounts and all the form data and browsing history [which I would rather have kept] is gone....but those rotten cookies are still alive! This must be a bug. I am using Mac Big Sur. Any help would be very much appreciated please! Thanks muchly.
creator: wendy_pip

title: Default print system
content:
Firefox automatically updated last night, and once again defaults to its own printer dialog box. I hate it. There is a link to use the system print dialog box but it only works for that specific print job -- which wastes a lot of time every time I want to print.

I can't find a setting to choose my system printer dialog box as default. the solutions from last year no longer work (about:config, then tab_mo, then print.tab_modal.enabled, set to false.

Anyone know how to fix this? It's enough to make me stop using the browser because the Firefox dialog box sucks.

title: FoxFire browser will not open websites.
content:
Dear Sir: 

   Over the past two days I have had problems with Foxfire browser not opening websites.  I have cleared history, refreshed, uninstalled and reinstalled the browser several times. This is a problem with both my laptop and my desktop. The desktop will not even arrive at the opening screen.  Microsoft Edge works.  AOL works. I have screened for viruses.  The tabs are blank and they keep churning.      I am running Windows 10 on both computers. I have gone thru the Control panel series of steps to make sure Foxfire is enabled properly with Windows 10 firewall.      I can get to the opening screen of Foxfire, but none of my bookmarks work.     For instance, I can sometimes access Yahoo Finance, but only when I open and close tabs that don't work several times using the box links to the several common websites featured in the opening screen for Foxfire. When I do the same routine with the Pocket recommended links the tabs open but just keep churning.    When I try to open Fidelity.com, neither clearing history, nor accessing through a Google Search nor from my favorite meets with any success. I've tried every means I know to open Fidelity.       Appreciate any suggestions.       Michael W. Styga
creator: michaelwstyga

title: Updated firefox, and now I'm in constant darkmode.
content:
I decided to update Firefox around January. It forced what is essentially night-mode on all of my websites (Youtube, Bank sites, google, etc), as seen with the pictures attached. I grabbed the white-backround firefox image from google, and edited in my theme to show what it used to look like. Obviously I didn't want this. In addition, that update essentially wiped all of my saved passwords and information on all of the sites I visit.

Well, knowing I had nothing to loose, I reverted to an earlier firefox update (95.0 I believe) and reinstalled my theme, and begain resaving my passwords. This fixed the issue of having Night-mode on all of my websites. Long behold, another update happened which I did not want and now I'm back to square one.

I assume it's because of the theme I'm using. Here but, I really like the theme and I've been using it for years.

Is there any way to fix the annoying night-mode type of backround? I'm perfectly fine with reverting the updates, but I'd like some way to transfer all of the passwords I have already saved again when I do it. I am also open to making my own theme that doesn't force me to use Night Mode, but I wouldn't even know where to begin. Thanks for any help.

content: I'm having a rendering issue using the latest firefox version (97.0) between Windows 7 and Windows 10 (VMWare is used for both environments for testing purposes). Additionally, in the windows 10 environment, if the page is zoomed in and back to 100%, the offset/issue goes away. Any pointers would be appreciated.
creator: keyspooner

title: Intermittent error loading js Chunk
content:
I work on a website that has an Angular front end that lazy loads js chunks via webpack.

Some of our users on Firefox (and only Firefox) have intermittently run into an issue where one or more of the js chunks will not load unless they clear their Firefox cache and try again, at which point Firefox will (correctly) load the previously unloaded js chunk. I've obtained HAR files from multiple affected users, and seen the pattern for myself. For example, in the screenshot I've shared, the single file shows -1 Bytes transferred, status code 0.

I have suspected extension or add-on (some sort of js or ad blocker), but some affected users swear that they see the problem even when all of their extensions are disabled. Now, my best guess is some sort of issue with the caching system in Firefox itself, but really, that is just a random guess.

I know, of course, that this is not enough information to debug this issue, but I hope that maybe this will ring a bell for someone, and they can point me in the right direction.

Here are two discussions (on our site) where users have been reporting the issue, including with some technical details: https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/2800974/cant-open-forum-threads-firefox https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/2788693/specific-videos-page-immediately-redirects-me-empt

title: Tabs Not Loading - Blank Tabs With Only The URL
content:
Since Firefox updated today I have had 2 issues.

The first issue is the biggest issue and the most frustrating.

I open a tab from a link on a page (both ctrl-click and right-click - new tab). As I'm going through each tab after opening multiple tabs, there are a few tabs that are just blank. The URL is in the address bar, but that's all. The button to reload is greyed out. I can't reload the URL. I can't do anything. I have to copy the URL, close the tab, bring up a new tab, and paste the URL. Then it will load.

This is random and doesn't happen to the same URL. Just randomly I have to copy paste a URL to open it in a new tab again.

The 2nd issue I had, and for me a minor one, it took me forever to log into support with my firefox account. It froze up a couple times after clicking the sign in button under my name and account. Eventually, I close the tab and when I came back to try again, viola, I was already logged in.

title: Firefox isn't loading pages or the browser.
content:
Firefox updated automatically and stopped working correctly afterward. This included: instances of the browser not opening after closing all tabs (I have been unable to open Firefox again unless restarting/shutting down and booting up the pc again), webpages failing to load properly (seen in attached screenshot), links to websites or content like videos on YouTube failing to load if right-clicked and the option "Open Link in New Tab" is selected and must be clicked at least twice, otherwise they fail to load like in the screenshot, and hanging while connecting to some websites with certain addons active (namely google.com). I also have reason to believe trying to fix these issues crashed my computer by locking it into a perpetual loop of crashing, collecting error data, restarting, and crashing again. Going back to Chrome to write this, I have had no problems.

I have tried refreshing Firefox several times, disabled hardware acceleration in the options, reinstalled about three times after deleting all Mozilla folders on my pc, disabled browser addons one by one to determine if one of them was causing problems, and removed and added Firefox to my firewall's allowed connections at least seven times by now.

tl/dr; Firefox broke after it automatically updated and I tried every solution I could search up. The browser still isn't working. Please help?
creator: silentthinker882

title: "root.home" Software is Preventing Firefox from Safely Connecting to this Site
content:
The past few days Firefox has intermittently refused to connect to any site and puts up the same error message mentioned in the title, blaming "root.home" as the cause. Unless this is linked to the new update I don't know why this has started now unless I have installed malware unknowingly or my new roommate or Vodafone have "put something on the network". Though from looking at other similar questions I think it may just be an issue with certificates?

I don't have any third-party antivirus, just Defender, date and time zone are set automatically and HTTPS Everywhere doesn't seem to be affecting the issue.

Does anyone know what "root.home" is, why it is causing this problem, and how I can stop it recurring every other time I use Firefox? (Apologies if this is an ignorant enquiry)

Thanks

I had 3 tabs open when I left yesterday for work and when I came back none of the 3 were loading just white screens and the loading icon next to the website just constantly spins I left it loading for 2 minutes before giving up.

I decided to try clearing out the cache, cookies, history, and basically all the options but passwords. Then I went ahead and tried again still no improvement. If I try opening a new tab and closing the others the same thing no difference.

I then noticed a windows update was going so I let it finish then restarted the computer and when it was ready checked firefox again and still nothing. So now I'm using Edge to type this out and am having no issue getting to any site that I was trying earlier.

Is there anything else I can do? Or is it like I gotta wait for a firefox update to come out?
creator: gamefrek184

title: Can't drag my tabs after updating to 97.0 (09 Feb 2022)
content:
I updated to 97.0 on 09 Feb 2022. I found out I could no longer drag my tabs around on the browser's tab bar.

I NEED THIS FEATURE TO WORK! Please, how can I bring it back?

Note: going to the about:config > [accepting risks and proceeding to the page] > typing "detach" in the search bar > scrolling down to browser.tabs.allowTabDetach to check for the value (False? True?) and setting it to True IS NOT RESTORING the ability to drag my tabs.

Please help?
creator: taimdala

title: Firefox won't Open
content:
This is what I have done so far:

I have done a full OS refresh of Windows 10.

Used Revo Uninstaller to remove all program files, Registry items.

Deleted all App data for every User account.

Re-installed Firefox with a fresh installer.

What happens:

After installing Firefox it will open once, and only once.

If I close it at any point, it will never open again unless I re-install it.

It will not open in Safe Firefox Safe mode (Holding shift) It will not open in Windows 10 Safe Mode It will not open with my firewall completely disabled my anti-virus uninstalled & off It will not open after restarting my PC It will not open after refreshing my OS again It will not open after Administrator Command Prompt ipconfig /flushdns It will not open after Administrator Command Prompt netsh winsock reset (And restarting) It will not open after clicking refresh re-installing it It will not open after deleting all extensions/cookies/profiles (again) It will not open after deleting all contents of the start-up folder. firefox.exe -p does not open or work

Firefox will only open -ONCE- immediately after re-installing it, I do not know what other options I have besides literally doing a clean install of my entire operating system.

I will get background processes when I try to open Firefox as if it's open, I've already tried closing them then opening again but the program still doesn't open.

I'm at the point where if I want to use firefox, I have to run the installer & it will open then I can use firefox until I close it then I have to run the installer again for it to open.

Literally everything works except for Firefox, I can run every program, game, stream/record video, etc. I have been bending over backwards doing everything I can to see if something else was going on, if anyone has any troubleshooting, I can try outside of what I've already done so far please let me know I'd like to resolve this without having to restore my entire PC for just firefox.


PC Specs: AMD Ryzen 7 32GB of Ram GPU Nvidia 2070 Windows 10 Home 21H2
creator: ayedog26

title: BOOKMARKS in WINDOWS 7 PRO
content: On my home tower PC, the Bookmarks appear on the left side of the screen (WINDOWS 7 HOME PREMIUM. On my laptop PC, when FIREFOX updated to the latest version in the past several months, the Bookmarks no longer appear on the left side of the screen immediately when I open FIREFOX. In order to see the Bookmarks, I have to click on a small icon at the upper right hand corner of the screen. Then, the Bookmarks appear on the right side of the screen. I have been through all the items in the Settings screen, checked each subheading for any item pertaining to moving the Bookmarks to the LEFT side, but have found nothing. I first checked your knowledge base, and while it reported 2 responses, neither one of them correctly addressed this particular problem. Please help.

I have an Alienware x17 R1 running Windows 10. Other browsers (Microsoft Edge, Opera) run fine.

title: All pages/tab on firefox are completly blank
content:
This morning I launched Firefox on my PC by opening a link in discord, I was greeted with a blank page, the link showed up in the search-bar and the tab icon shows up, but there was no content whatsoever on the rest of the page. I tried restoring my last browsing session, and all tabs where similarly blank. Attached an image of what I see on a new tab page as well as any other page. The only settings menu I was able to open was "more troubleshooting info" page, by which i mean it is the only thing that actually loaded any content. Things I have tried: -Refreshing Firefox. It seem to go through the process, but when it is done the pages are similarly blank. -Uninstalling, then reinstalling. I reset my computer after uninstalling and then re-downloaded Firefox, same results. -Logging out of Firefox. I didn't really expect this to do anything but tried just in case. -Refreshing the cashe. I used the shortcut to open the browser history clear, and cleared cookies and cashe. -Opening Firefox in safe mode, has the same issue. -Used my anti-malware Webroot Security to check my computer for malware, nothing turned up. -Re-allowing Firefox through windows firewall. Did this by removing it from the list of allowed programs, then adding it again. -Ensuring my compatibility preferences didn't have anything selected. -Through the troubleshooting page I was able to access the about:config page (this page would not load if i opened a new tab and typed in about:config, ONLY if I changed the URL from about:support, the only page i could load, to about:config) and ensuring that browser.newtabpage.enabled was set to true.

Firefox is working perfectly fine on my laptop, and I was working last night on my PC, the only difference being that was a small windows update. It has never done this before.
creator: cakedustmc
